title: Fix message bar not damaged when the same size
body:
The regression was added due to `y` coordinate in OpenGL differs to `y` inside the damage rectangles.

Fixes: 40160c5d (Damage only terminal inside `alacritty_terminal`)

title: Alacritty version 0.13.0-rc1
body: Should probably wait for https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/pull/7424.

title: Don't emit text for NamedKey without text repr
body:
When the key doesn't have textual representation we shouldn't emit the text for them, since they are processed via bindings.

Fixes #7423.

title: Fix trigger of normal bindings in mouse mode
body:
We should ensure that the `Shift` is actually pressed when trying to prefer regular bindings instead of the ones if we had Shift applied.

Fixes: 500b696ca8ed (Prefer exact matches for bindings in mouse mode)
Fixes #7415.

title: Fix chars usage inside the mouse bindings
body: Fixes #7413.

title: Fallback to underline shader when dotted fails
body: Some hardware is just bad.

title: Optimize undercurl shader
body: This removes the if and lowers amount of operations.

title: Don't use `::*` for enum variants in bindings
Fix DECRPM reporting
body:
The DECRQM uses `p` to query, but the reply uses `y`.

Fixes #7397.

title: Adjust default Vi's SearchBackwards binding
body: We have the same policy with Shift for numbers.

title: Make AA stronger for undercurl
body:
This improves undercurl rendering preserving its original thickness. This also makes it look not out-of place when places next to other lines.

--

Before

![image](https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/assets/27620401/7898007a-eb08-499e-9962-b54af321533d)

After

![image](https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/assets/27620401/11467e0c-c1c1-429d-aa49-d799773fbaf2)

title: Bump dependencies
body: Update dependencies with `cargo update` as well as do explicit update of winit, crossfont, and regex-automata.

title: Damage entire window on font size change
body:
Font size could change without changing the cell dimensions, like becoming slightly higher/wider.

Fixes: 40160c5d (Damage only terminal inside `alacritty_terminal`)

title: Fix IME popup positioning
body:
When setting cursor area, the popup will be placed either above or below not obscuring the supplied region, however we were still offsetting line with `+1` putting the cursor at the bottom of the line, and given that area is from the top-left corner, the wrong area was marked for not being obscured.

It was also discovered that some compositors, like GNOME, position IME in the bottom right corner of the supplied region, which is wrong, but it renders IME popup not very useful, since it's far away from the place it should be, thus try to not obscure just a few characters near the cursor.

Given that X11 doesn't support area setting, it uses the old logic with offsetting.

title: Improve man pages docs
body:
--

Just view each commit individually with its message.

title: Create only one branch per major release
body:
Having a separate branch for each release makes it harder to maintain without an actual benefit, since every release from the major version is linear, so creating branches doesn't make any sense.

They also collapse with the tag names leading to ambiguous refs.

--

We've discussed it at some point, and I remember you've agreed. The goal is to make it simpler.

title: Add support for DECRQM/DECRPM
body: Applications rely on it to detect sync updates.

title: Damage only terminal inside `alacritty_terminal`
body:
The damage tracking was including selection and vi_cursor which were rendering viewport related, however all the damage tracking inside the `alacritty_terminal` was _terminal viewport_ related, meaning that it should be affected by `display_offset`.

Refactor the damage tracking so `alacritty_terminal` is only tracking actual terminal updates and properly applying display offset to them, while `alacritty` pulls this damage into its own UI damage state.

Fixes #7111.

title: Use DEC mode 2026 for Sync capability
body:
Alacritty has supported mode 2026 for synchronized updates for a few
months [1], but the terminfo entry still uses the old DCS sequence
originally supported by iTerm2. Since many other terminal emulators and
applications seem to be [standardizing around 2026](https://gist.github.com/christianparpart/d8a62cc1ab659194337d73e399004036), change the terminfo
entry to use SM instead of DCS.

Note that even iTerm2's wiki now recommends using `DECSET`/`DECRST` instead of DCS: https://gitlab.com/gnachman/iterm2/-/wikis/synchronized-updates-spec#decsetdecreset

[1]: https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/commit/47d500770a7fe306d710ca2cd9a0758c27a639a2

title: Simplify powerline drawing algorithm
body:
Iterate over points in line instead of drawing it right away
and then finding it in the buffer.

Fixes: 4a26667060 (Use builtin font to draw powerline symbols)

title: Fix Vi cursor not being dirty when scrolling
Change default `bell.animation` to `Linear`
body: The default animation feels really choppy, but it's just how its function looks.

title: Fix message bar damage
body: Fixes #7224.

title: Fix visual bell getting stuck on macOS
body: Fixes #7325.

title: Fix cursor being hidden after reaching timeout
body: The timeout and blink events could be delivered at the same time, so canceling blinking won't work and we'll still have an event.

title: Add `--option` argument to `create-window`
body:
This patch adds a new CLI parameter to the `create-window` subcommand,
matching the existing `--option` parameter when creating a new Alacritty
instance.

This parameter allows setting up the initial window configuration from
the CLI without having to call `alacritty msg config`, making sure that
all options are set appropriately right from the start.

Closes #6238.

---

This is split into two patches, the first one being technically optional. However it hopefully makes understanding these changes a little easier.

title: Bump ahash dependency
body:
The current version of `ahash`, 0.8.3 was yanked due to this vulnerability: https://github.com/tkaitchuck/aHash/issues/163

This PR bumps it to 0.8.6, the latest version.

title: Fix crash when leaving search after resize
body:
This fixes a crash which could occur when leaving search with a visible match after shrinking the terminal height to be lower than the original line the focused match was in.

Closes #7054.

title: Report errors during OpenGL initialization
body:
Alacritty crashes on Windows in a VM (eg. in virtsh on Linux or in UTM on MacOS) due to shader version reported as NULL. Alacritty shows absolutely no information about the crash, even in the verbose mode. This PR makes two improvements:

* Instead of a crash, an error is returned to the caller.
* The Windows build of Alacritty shows the error in a message box and on the the parent console.

title: Bump glutin to 0.31.1
body:
This fixes a crash on startup with macOS Sonoma.

--

Crash is not present with glutin 0.30.x series.

title: Add man 5 pages to upload_asset.sh
body: They are compiled, but not being uploaded.

title: Remove `alacritty_config` from alacritty_terminal
body: There's no need to force alacritty's user configuration on other users of the crate, thus provide the options actually used by alacritty_terminal itself.

title: Add `window.blur` config option
body: Fixes #972.

title: Add version 0.12.3 to CHANGELOG
body: This is only an update to the development version and does not represent a stable release.

title: Fix clippy warnings
body:
Tested in 8 combinations:
```
cargo {+stable,+nightly} clippy {,--all-targets} {,--release}
```

* Fixed warnings about unused imports. One import is only used for tests, another import is not needed at all.
* Replaced `get(0)` with `first()` in tests as suggested by nightly clippy.

title: Avoid maximizing window when creating new tab
body:
This patch clears the startup mode when creating a new tab on macOS to avoid maximizing an existing window.

Fixes #7313

title: Fix crash due to wrong drop order of clipboard
body: Fixes #7309.

title: Prefer exact matches for bindings in mouse mode
body:
Only consider bindings without Shift if there are no actions defined for the actual mouse event.

Fixes #7292

title: Fix `window.decorations_theme_variant` reload
body:
The live reload handling wasn't introduced when the option got added.

Fixes #7295.

title: Fix regex patterns allowing for empty strings
body:
This patch changes the mode we search for patterns which allow an empty string, by anchoring all searches. As a result we will match the longest possible match when multiple patterns are present (like `;*|rust`), instead of using the leftmost pattern only.

This is only possible with empty matches since our parser is reset on every byte anyway, so anchoring the search makes no difference.

Closes #7276.

---

In theory this would allow us to split the parsers (so `regex_search_internal`) completely for empty and non-empty patterns. This would probably speed up the non-empty version but I'm not sure it is worse the mess.

title: Use rustix-openpty instead of nix
body:
This should remove our dependency on nix which tends to do breaking changes pretty often resulting in lots of their deps being in the tree.

The upstream libraries we use also move to rustix.

title: Fix PTY being closed on creation
body:
The PTY got closed because `OwnedFd` automatically closed it.

Fixes: 59c63d37 (Update dependencies)

title: Fix regex matches ending on multiline
body:
This fixes an issue where the reverse search for the regex start would
truncate a character when ending on a newline, since it was omitting the
EOI check in that case.

This also fixes a separate issue which caused regexes which capture
empty strings (e.g.: `.*`) to always report a match.

This is a regression introduced in 73276b6.

title: Alacritty version 0.12.3-rc1
body:
--

I don't see any issue with doing a short rc and a patch release. The `0.13.0` will take **at least** a month (2 weeks for winit release, then some time to update, then **at least** a week `rc`), and it could even require roundtrips with winit on versions...

The changes were made by `cargo update -p winit` and `cargo update -p smithay-client-toolkit`.

title: Update the escape_support.md for sync updates
body:
Remove the DCS sync updates escape sequence since it's no longer supported.

Fixes: 47d500770a (Bump VTE to 0.12.0)

title: Underline hint matches during selection
body:
This patch underlines the full regex hint match while the keyboard hint selection is in process.

While it would be possible to color the entire match, this would only introduce unnecessary configuration options and be too noisy. The underline matches the mouse highlighting and has a less drastic visual impact.

Closes #6178.

title: Add inline vi mode search
body:
This patch adds inline search to vi mode using `f`/`F` and `t`/`T` as default bindings. The behavior matches that of vim.

Closes #7203.

---

There's a very good chance I missed an edge case or 16, so this probably needs a bit of manual testing.

title: Update winit to 0.29.2
body:
Fixes #7236.
Fixes #7201.
Fixes #6848.
Fixes #3601.
Fixes #3108.
Fixes #2453.

title: Fix regex memory usage
body:
This fixes an issue where regexes with a large number of possible states
would consume excessive memory, since the entire DFA was compiled ahead
of time.

To solve this, the DFA is now built at runtime using `regex-automata`'s
hybrid DFA.

There are however still some checks performed ahead of time, causing
errors with obscenely large regexes (`[0-9A-Za-z]{999999999}`), which
shouldn't cause any issues.

A regex which is large, but not large enough to fail the NFA
construction (like `[0-9A-Za-z]{999999}`) will cause a long search of
the entire grid, but will complete and show the match.

Closes #7097.

title: Test man-pages compilation on the CI
Allow x padding to go over 255
body: Extremely simple fix that just changes padding type to `u16` as requested by #6900.

title: Improve quoting and add examples in man pages
Fix crash with anchored searches
body: While this does **not** enable the use of anchors (`^`) in user regexes, it does prevent Alacritty from crashing when attempting to do so.

title: Update dependencies
body:
This patch applies all breaking and non-breaking dependencies, to ensure everything is using the latest available package versions.

The only things which weren't updated were mio and wayland-client.

title: Add EGL_OVER_GLX environment variable
body:
After v0.11.0 rendering sometimes paused indefinitely until a keystroke was registered, but not necessarily rendering the change caused by the new keystroke. This issue seems to be related to GLX in conjunction with Nvidia drivers on linux systems, and using EGL instead fixes the issue.

Closes #7056

title: Update regex-automata to v0.3.6
body:
This seems like a sensible first step before looking into #7097.

---

While this in theory fixes #7097 by erroring-out, I'd like to look into sparse regexes with a follow-up PR that hopefully solves the issue completely and doesn't error out.

title: Remove winit dependency from alacritty_config crate
body:
The [Zed](https://zed.dev) editor uses the `alacritty_terminal` crate as a library. Currently, that requires that we compile `winit` and its dependencies as part of our build, because the `alacritty_config` depends on `winit` for the `OptionAsAlt` type.

This PR removes the dependency on `winit` from the `alacritty_config` crate. I did this by creating a verbatim copy of the `OptionAsAlt` enum in the `alacritty::config::window` module, and wrote a function that converts this enum into its `winit` equivalent.

It adds a little bit of boilerplate to that module, for converting between the two types, but is pretty simple, and makes the `alacritty_terminal` crate more convenient to use as a library on macOS.

title: Fix spelling of decorations_theme_variant in the manual
Copy global IPC options for new windows
body:
This patch stores all options set for the Window ID `-1` and automatically applies them to new windows after their creation.

This in theory makes it possible to have a fully dynamic "default config" without having to reapply it for every new window.

Closes #7128.

title: Implement kitty's keyboard protocol
body:
The protocol enables robust key reporting for the applications, so they could bind more keys and the user won't have collisions with the legacy control keys.

Fixes #6378.
Links: https://sw.kovidgoyal.net/kitty/keyboard-protocol

--

Only draft because of vte. I've also hasn't updated man pages, because the modes could be renamed. Besides everything should work...

title: Add `terminal` config section to control OSCs
body:
Some environments demand certain OSC sequences to be disabled or some escape sequence could require handling which is out of scope of alacritty, but could be done by external script (OSC 777).

Added section for now just handles the `OSC 52` sequence and changes its default to be `OnlyCopy`, which is handy for remote copy, but `Paste` is redundant because normal `Paste` hotkey could be used as well.

Fixes #3386.

title: Use ahash instead of fnv and regular hash function
body:
After evaluation of the ahash with the data alacritty uses it was discovered that it's 1.5-2x times faster when getting the already hashed values, which is the primary cases for alacritty's renderer.

Given that ahash is generally faster, all the HashSet and HashMap's inside the alacritty were changed to use it as a hasher function.

--

You can play with the benchmark here https://git.sr.ht/~kchibisov/hash-bench it uses `cargo bench`.

My results were

```
running 6 tests
test benches::ahash_get    ... bench:      38,873 ns/iter (+/- 1,023)
test benches::ahash_insert ... bench:      84,969 ns/iter (+/- 2,716)
test benches::fnv_get      ... bench:      57,062 ns/iter (+/- 982)
test benches::fnv_insert   ... bench:      90,400 ns/iter (+/- 1,016)
test benches::std_get      ... bench:     164,550 ns/iter (+/- 3,032)
test benches::std_insert   ... bench:     238,054 ns/iter (+/- 7,363)
```

As you can see, the `get` perf of `ahash` is way better than other options.

title: Make URL_REGEX more strict
body: Current URL_REGEX matches things like `http::trace::on_request::log_parameters` which are not valid URLs, the patch fixes this, by requiring `//` after all protocols that should have it.

title: Mention `Forward`/`Back` mouse buttons in man page
body: They were mentioned only in the changelog, but forgotten in the man page.

title: Fix keys like `+` not working on neo layouts
body: The key_without_modifier removes all the modifiers including the multiple shift levels, which is not desired. In alacritty we just wanted to treat uppercase and lowercase latters the same, which we can with the help of builtin functions.

title: Update license field following SPDX 2.1 license expression standard
body: The new recommendation is to follow the SPDX 2.1 standard. This allows automatic license verification software to work properly. Reference: https://doc.rust-lang.org/cargo/reference/manifest.html#the-license-and-license-file-fields

title: Fix manpage docs for shell section
body: Closes #7087.

title: Don't use mutable references unnecessarily
body: This fixes all issues found by the nightly clippy.

title: Skip whitespaces for wide chars in preedit
body:
While we skip the spacers for the wide characters in the grid due to them having a proper flags, the draw_string method was generating the cells with incorrect flags leading to wide chars being cut off.

--

I'm not sure I like this fix.

title: Use bracketed paste only for multi-char IME input
body: Some IME setups do only `commit` single char input, like fcitx5 when doing ru input.

title: Use lowercase latters in bindings for h/m/l
body: They were using uppercase latters, however our config expects everything as lowercase, because we're using `key_without_modifiers` + `ModifiersState`.

title: Fix: apply transparent-background-colors for selections
body:
Closes https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/issues/6859


https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/assets/67749330/c57bf30d-a182-4033-a568-ac7ebfa89a29

title: Prefer logical key for named keys
body:
Some keyboard layouts have named logical keys via shift combinations of some sorts. So prefer them.

Fixes #7076.

title: Mention all the actions in the man page
body:
A lot of actions were left without a notice, so the only way to figure out some of them was to browse source code. An example of such actions were `Maximize` and `Minimize`, since we don't have a binding for them, so they were left even in alacritty-bindings(5).

Explicitly list all the bindings we have. The search bindings were also not accuratelly restricted, since we allow them to be executed inside regardless of mode.

title: Update winit to 0.29.1-beta
body: Closes #7011.

title: Fix `window.option_as_alt=Both`
body: Fixes #7077.

title: Raise double click threshold to 400ms
body:
This should improve the situation with some touchpads. GTK4 is also using the same value.

--

In the issue #7011 the time between the clicks is 370ms if you look into the wayland debug logs, so I guess on some systems it's too tight?

title: Unset `XDG_ACTIVATION_TOKEN` in alacritty_terminal
body:
This variable is what being used for Wayland's activation stuff.

--

Don't think that this needs a changelog.

title: Update mentions of key_bindings and mouse_bindings in the manual
Fix legacy bindings taking precedence over new ones
body:
They were compared by len, but it's was wrong from the start, since a user provided binding could remove more than one builtin binding, so it was impossible for users to use their own bindings.

The most reliable way to do so is to use `Option`, given that we fill default during deserialization.

Fixes #7050.

title: Add a note in README about older versions
body: Unfortunatelly it's not clear to everyone that they are looking at the development documentation.

title: features.md: Fix configuration link typo
body: Saw a square bracket standing in for the letter 'c'; attempted to fix with a markdown relative link instead of just removing it.

title: Add version 0.12.2 to CHANGELOG
body: This is only an update to the development version and does not represent a stable release.

title: Remove mouse double_click/triple_click options
body: Closes https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/issues/6962

title: Ignore scrolling multiplier when using touchscreen
body:
This causes the scrolling multiplier to be ignored when scrolling using the touchscreen. Without this change, scrolling is out of sync with the position of the finger on the touchscreen.


_(Before this patch, with the default scrolling multiplier of 3, scrolling appears to be in sync when scrolling in the primary buffer, but when scrolling in the alternate screen buffer, e.g. when using weechat or vim, then it will be too slow.)_

title: Add manpage link from to alacritty-bindings
Update wix on the release CI
body:
Fixes #6939.

--

https://github.com/kchibisov/alacritty/releases/tag/v0.1.1111 seems to work.

title: Add TOML migration recommendation to warning
body: This adds a little recommendation to use `alacritty migrate` to automatically transition configuration files from YAML to TOML.
